33   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
34   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | 
37   | #include <stdio.h>
38   | #include <stdarg.h>
39   | #include <tcl.h>
40   | #include "config.h"
41   | #include "uvec.h"
42   | 
43   | #ifndef CONST84
44   | #  define CONST84	/* const */
45   | #endif
46   | 
47   | #if (TCL_MAJOR_VERSION < 8)
48   | #  define TCL_RESULT(interp) ((interp)->result)
49   | #else
50   | #  define TCL_RESULT(interp) Tcl_GetStringResult(interp)
51   | #endif
52   | 
53   | #ifndef HAVE_STDINT_H
54   | /* assume 32 bit - hope for the best */
55   | typedef	int	intptr_h;
56   | #endif
57   | 
58   | #ifdef HAVE_STDLIB_H
59   | #  include <stdlib.h>
60   | #endif
61   | 
62   | #if STDC_HEADERS || HAVE_STRING_H
63   | #  include <string.h>
64   | /**
65   |  **  An ANSI string.h and pre-ANSI memory.h might conflict.
66   |  **/
67   | #  if !STDC_HEADERS && HAVE_MEMORY_H
68   | #    include <memory.h>
69   | #  endif /** not STDC_HEADERS and HAVE_MEMORY_H **/
70   | #else /** not STDC_HEADERS and not HAVE_STRING_H **/
71   | #  include <strings.h>
72   | /**
73   |  **  memory.h and strings.h conflict on some systems.
74   |  **/
75   | #endif /** not STDC_HEADERS and not HAVE_STRING_H  **/
76   | 
77   | #ifdef HAVE_UNISTD_H
78   | #  include <unistd.h>
79   | #  include <sys/types.h>
80   | #endif
81   | 
82   | #ifdef HAVE_CTYPE_H
83   | #  include <ctype.h>
84   | #endif
85   | 
86   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_MODE_H
87   | /* #include <sys/mode.h> */
88   | #endif
89   | 
90   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
91   | #  include <sys/stat.h>
92   | #endif
93   | 
94   | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_TERMIOS_H
95   | #  include <sys/termios.h>
96   | #else
97   | #  ifdef HAVE_TERMIO_H
98   | #    include <termio.h>
99   | #  endif
100  | #endif
101  | 
102  | #ifdef HAVE_FCNTL_H
103  | #  include <fcntl.h>
104  | #endif
105  | 
106  | #if !defined(TIOCGWINSZ) && defined(HAVE_SYS_IOCTL_H)
107  | #  include <sys/ioctl.h>
108  | #endif
109  | 
110  | #if defined(DIRENT) || defined(_POSIX_VERSION)
111  | #  include <dirent.h>
112  | #  define NLENGTH(dirent) (strlen((dirent)->d_name))
113  | #else /** not (DIRENT or _POSIX_VERSION) **/
114  | #  define dirent direct
115  | #  define NLENGTH(dirent) ((dirent)->d_namlen)
116  | #  ifdef SYSNDIR
117  | #    include <sys/ndir.h>
118  | #  endif /** SYSNDIR **/
119  | #  ifdef SYSDIR
120  | #    include <sys/dir.h>
121  | #  endif /** SYSDIR **/
122  | #  ifdef NDIR
123  | #    include <ndir.h>
124  | #  endif /** NDIR **/
125  | #endif /** not (DIRENT or _POSIX_VERSION) **/
126  | 
127  | #ifdef HAVE_ERRNO_H
128  | #  include <errno.h>
129  | #else
130  | extern	int	  errno;
131  | #endif
132  | 
133  | #ifdef HAVE_LOCALE_H
134  | #  include <locale.h>
135  | #endif
136  | 
137  | #if ENABLE_NLS
138  | #  include <libintl.h>
139  | #  define _(String) gettext(String)
140  | #else
141  | #  define _(String) (String)
142  | #endif
143  | /* gettext_noop() equivalent */
144  | #define N_(String) (String)
145  | 
146  | #ifdef HAVE_ASSERT_H
147  | #  include <assert.h>
148  | #else
149  | #warning "not able to test code assertions"
150  | #define assert(condition)
151  | #endif
152  | 
153  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
154  | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
155  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
156  | 
157  | /**
158  |  **  Module hash type - uses Tcl_*Hash*() underneath
159  |  **/
160  | typedef enum {
161  | 	MHashNULL = 0,				/** invalid value	**/
162  | 	MHashInt,				/** integer values	**/
163  | 	MHashStrings,				/** string storage	**/
164  | 	MHashRefCounts,				/** strings &		**/
165  | 						/**   reference counts	**/
166  | 	MHashFiles				/** files & dirs	**/
167  | } MHashType;
168  | 
169  | typedef struct _mhash {
170  | 	MHashType	type;			/** what type is this	**/
171  | 	uvec		*keys;			/** vector of keys	**/
172  | 	Tcl_HashTable	*hash;			/** hash container	**/
173  | 	int		(*add)(void **,va_list);/** fn copy/create data	**/
174  | 	int		(*del)(void **,va_list);/** fn delete data	**/
175  | } MHash;
176  | 
177  | typedef enum {
178  | 	GHashNULL = 0,				/** invalid value	**/
179  | 	GHashClear,				/** Clear  global hashes**/
180  | 	GHashDelete,				/** Delete global hashes**/
181  | 	GHashCopy,				/** Copy   global hashes**/
182  | } GHashAction;
183  | 
184  | /**
185  |  **  Structure to store information about a file.  Includes its name
186  |  **  and the structure to store information from the stat system call.
187  |  **/
188  | 
189  | typedef struct _file_entry {
190  |     char*        fi_prefix;
191  |     char*        fi_name;
192  |     struct stat  fi_stats;
193  |     int          fi_listcount;
194  |     struct _file_entry* fi_subdir;
195  | } fi_ent;
196  | 
197  | /**
198  |  **  Error handling (see error.c for weight and message)
199  |  **/
200  | 
201  | typedef	enum	{
202  | 	NO_ERR = 0,			/** No error			     **/
203  | 	NO_ERR_VERBOSE,			/** Verbose messages		     **/
204  | 	ERR_PARAM = 10,			/** Parameter error		     **/
205  | 	ERR_USAGE,			/** Usage information		     **/
206  | 	ERR_ARGSTOLONG,			/** Arguments to long		     **/
207  | 	ERR_OPT_AMBIG = 40,		/** Option is ambiguous		     **/
208  | 	ERR_OPT_NOARG,			/** Option allows no argument	     **/
209  | 	ERR_OPT_REQARG,			/** Option requires an argument	     **/
210  | 	ERR_OPT_UNKNOWN,		/** Unrecognized option 	     **/
211  | 	ERR_OPT_ILL,			/** Illegal option 		     **/
212  | 	ERR_OPT_INV,			/** Invalid option 		     **/
213  | 	ERR_USERLVL,			/** Unknown userlevel		     **/
214  | 	ERR_GETOPT,			/** getopt() failed		     **/
215  | 	ERR_OPEN = 50,			/** Error opening file		     **/
216  | 	ERR_POPEN,			/** Error opening pipe	    	     **/
217  | 	ERR_OPENDIR,			/** Error opening directory	     **/
218  | 	ERR_CHDIR,			/** can not chdir to directory	     **/
219  | 	ERR_CLOSE,			/** Error when closing a file	     **/
220  | 	ERR_PCLOSE,			/** Error when closing a pipe	     **/
221  | 	ERR_CLOSEDIR,			/** Error when closing a directory   **/
222  | 	ERR_READ,			/** Error when reading from a file   **/
223  | 	ERR_READDIR,			/** Error when reading directory     **/
224  | 	ERR_WRITE,			/** Error when writing to a file     **/
225  | 	ERR_SEEK,			/** Seek error			     **/
226  | 	ERR_FLUSH,			/** Flush error			     **/
227  | 	ERR_DUP,			/** File duplication error	     **/
228  | 	ERR_DIRNAME,			/** Cannot build directory name	     **/
229  | 	ERR_NAMETOLONG,			/** Directory name to long	     **/
230  | 	ERR_DIRNOTFOUND,		/** Directory not found		     **/
231  | 	ERR_FILEINDIR,			/** File not in directory	     **/
232  | 	ERR_NODIR,			/** Not a directory		     **/
233  | 	ERR_UNLINK,			/** Cannot unlink file		     **/
234  | 	ERR_RENAME,			/** Cannot rename file		     **/
235  | 	ERR_ALLOC = 70,			/** Out of memory		     **/
236  | 	ERR_UVEC,			/** general UVEC error		     **/
237  | 	ERR_MHASH,			/** general MHash error		     **/
238  | 	ERR_SOURCE,			/** Error while sourcing ...	     **/
239  | 	ERR_UNAME,			/** Uname failed		     **/
240  | 	ERR_GETHOSTNAME,		/** gethostname failed		     **/
241  | 	ERR_GETDOMAINNAME,		/** getdomainname failed	     **/
242  | 	ERR_STRING,			/** string error		     **/
243  | 	ERR_DISPLAY = 90,		/** cannot open display	    	     **/
244  | 	ERR_IN_MODULEFILE = 100,	/** modulefile related errors	     **/
245  | 	ERR_PARSE,			/** Parse error (modulefile)	     **/
246  | 	ERR_EXEC,			/** Execution error (modulefile)     **/
247  | 	ERR_EXTRACT,			/** Cannot extract X11 ressources    **/
248  | 	ERR_COMMAND,			/** Unrecognized command	     **/
249  | 	ERR_LOCATE,			/** Module file not found	     **/
250  | 	ERR_MAGIC,			/** Bad magic number		     **/
251  | 	ERR_MODULE_PATH,		/** Module path not set		     **/
252  | 	ERR_HOME,			/** Home not set		     **/
253  | 	ERR_SHELL,			/** Unknown shell type		     **/
254  | 	ERR_DERELICT,			/** Unknown shell derelict	     **/
255  | 	ERR_CONFLICT = 150,		/** Module file conflicts	     **/
256  | 	ERR_PREREQ,			/** Module file prerequirements	     **/
257  | 	ERR_NOTLOADED,			/** Module file is currently not l.  **/
258  | 	ERR_DUP_SYMVERS,		/** Duplicate symbolic version	     **/
259  | 	ERR_SYMLOOP,			/** Loop in symbol version def.	     **/
260  | 	ERR_BADMODNAM,			/** Bad modulename in version, alias **/
261  | 	ERR_DUP_ALIAS,			/** Duplicate alias		     **/
262  | 	ERR_BEGINENV,			/** No update if no .modulesbeginenv **/
263  | 	ERR_BEGINENVX,			/** No MODULESBEGINENV env.var.      **/
264  | 	ERR_INIT_TCL,			/** Cannot initialize TCL	     **/
265  | 	ERR_INIT_TCLX,			/** Cannot initialize extended TCL   **/
266  | 	ERR_INIT_ALPATH,		/** Cannot set up autoload path      **/
267  | 	ERR_INIT_STUP,			/** No 'module load in the shellstups**/
268  | 	ERR_SET_VAR,			/** Cannot set TCL variable	     **/
269  | 	ERR_INFO_DESCR,			/** Unrecognized module info descr.  **/
270  | 	ERR_INVWGHT_WARN,		/** Invalid error weight	     **/
271  | 	ERR_INVFAC_WARN,		/** Invalid error facility	     **/
272  | 	ERR_INTERNAL = 990,		/** Error logger internal error	     **/
273  | 	ERR_INTERAL,			/** Alias module internal error	     **/
274  | 	ERR_INTERRL,			/** Error logger internal error	     **/
275  | 	ERR_INVAL,			/** Invalid parameter to the error   **/
276  | 	ERR_INVWGHT,			/** logger			     **/
277  | 	ERR_INVFAC,			/** Invalid error facility	     **/
278  |         ERR_ENVVAR			/** env. variables are inconsistent  **/
279  | } ErrType;
280  | 
281  | /**
282  |  **  Error return values. Only OK, PROBLEM and ERROR will be returned to the
283  |  **  caller, In case of the remaining, the error handler takes control over the
284  |  **  whole application.
285  |  **/
286  | typedef	enum	{
287  | 	OK	= 0,			/** Everything's up and running	     **/
288  | 	WARN	= 2,			/** A warning (mapped to OK by the   **/
289  | 					/** Errorlogger)		     **/
290  | 	PROBLEM	= 5,			/** Problem ... program might cont.  **/
291  | 	ERROR	= 7,			/** Error .. try gracefull aborting  **/
292  | 	FATAL	= 10,			/** The following will lead to the   **/
293  | 	PANIC	= 20			/** program being aborted by the     **/
294  | 					/** error logger immediatelly	     **/
295  | } ErrCode;
296  | 
297  | /**
298  |  **  Internal return value to handle the various ways a module load
299  |  **	could end.
300  |  **/
301  | typedef enum	{
302  | 	EM_OK		= 0,		/** normal return	**/
303  | 	EM_EXIT,			/** cmd: exit N		**/
304  | 					/** (set g_retval = N)	**/
305  | 	EM_BREAK,			/** cmd: break		**/
306  | 	EM_CONTINUE,			/** cmd: continue	**/
307  | 	EM_ERROR			/** abnormal return	**/
308  | } EM_RetVal;
309  |

335  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_VERBOSE		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".info"
336  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_INFO		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".notice"
337  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_DEBUG		DEF_FACILITY ".debug"
338  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_WARN		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".warning"
339  | #define	DEF_FACILITY_PROB		"stderr:" DEF_FACILITY ".warning"

350  | #define      M_SWSTATE1	0x0004
351  | #define      M_SWSTATE2	0x0008
352  | #define      M_SWSTATE3	0x0010
353  | #define      M_SWITCH	( M_SWSTATE1 | M_SWSTATE2 | M_SWSTATE3)
354  | #define      M_LOAD	0x0020
355  | #define      M_CLEAR	0x0040
356  | #define      M_PREPEND	0x0080
357  | #define      M_HELP	0x0100
358  | #define      M_WHATIS	0x0200
359  | #define      M_NONPERSIST	0x0400
360  |

367  | #define      PRE_SW_MARKER   "--PREMARKER--"  /**  for prepending paths  **/

398  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
399  | /**				      MACROS				     **/
400  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
401  | 
402  | /**
403  |  **  I'm going to remove all of the calls to free( ) since they are not
404  |  **    necessary for Modules.  Since the modulecmd program is only run for
405  |  **    a very short time ( usually <1sec) it's faster to not clutter the heap
406  |  **    by freeing up memory.
407  |  **
408  |  **  If you disagree with this decision, or have some problems with this
409  |  **    behavior on your system, configure with --enable-free
410  |  **
411  |  **  Note that all memory deallocations should go through null_free()
412  |  **/
413  | 
414  | #ifndef USE_FREE
415  | #  define  free( x)  
416  | #  define  FreeList( x)  
417  | #endif
418  | 
419  | /** 
420  |  **  Some systems don't define S_ISDIR and S_ISREG
421  |  **/
422  | 
423  | #ifdef HAVE_SYS_STAT_H
424  | #  ifndef S_ISDIR
425  | #    define S_ISDIR( m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFDIR)
426  | #  endif
427  | #  ifndef S_ISREG
428  | #    define S_ISREG( m) (((m) & S_IFMT) == S_IFREG)
429  | #  endif
430  | #endif
431  | 
432  | /**
433  |  **  Error logger
434  |  **/
435  | 
436  | #define	ErrorLogger	Module_Error
437  | #define	LOC		module_name, __LINE__
